body_html:
Ok, I was not aware that tf.layers.Layer is only supposed to be used for built-in layers. My understanding was that tf.layers sits beside Keras and could be used on it's own. And since there was no Network or Model in tf.layers I used Layer.

But if the expectation is that everyone uses tf.keras.Model that's ok.
body_text:
Ok, I was not aware that tf.layers.Layer is only supposed to be used for built-in layers. My understanding was that tf.layers sits beside Keras and could be used on it's own. And since there was no Network or Model in tf.layers I used Layer.
But if the expectation is that everyone uses tf.keras.Model that's ok.
body:
Ok, I was not aware that `tf.layers.Layer` is only supposed to be used for built-in layers. My understanding was that `tf.layers` sits beside Keras and could be used on it's own. And since there was no `Network` or `Model` in `tf.layers` I used `Layer`.

But if the expectation is that everyone uses `tf.keras.Model` that's ok.
